text:
substance: Mercury (inorganic) | type_of_trv: Oral TDI
[For exposure to
mercury through
consumption of
fish, seafood,
and marine
mammals, use
the TRV for
methylmercury,
the predominant
form of mercury
in these foods.] | trv_value: 3.0E-04
mg/kg -day
BW | study_details: Druet et al., 1978 | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: LOAEL =
0.226 mg/kg -day
BW
(after conversion
from subcutaneous
to oral route) | trv_derivation_method: US EPA selected a drinking
water equivalent level
(DWEL) of 0.010 mg/L
based on the three studies.
US EPA used the DWEL
to derive an RfD:
Oral RfD =
DWEL × IR / BW
W adult
[where IR = 2 L/day and
w
BW = 70 kg]
adult | critical_effect_s: Immunotoxicity
(autoimmune
glomerulonephritis) | carcinogenicity_classification: CEPA:
not classified
IARC: Group 3
not classifiable as to
its carcinogenicity
to humans
(IARC, 1993)
US EPA IRIS:
Group D
not classifiable
as to human
carcinogenicity
(US EPA, 1995b) | source: CCME, 1999a,b
and
US EPA, 1995b
(based on
Druet et al., 1978;
Bernaudin et al.,
1981;
Andres, 1984)

substance: Mercury (inorganic) | study_details: Study Type: subchronic
Species: Brown Norway rats
Mode of Administration: subcutaneous
injection
Exposure Regime: 0, 0.1, 0.25, 0.5,
1, and 2 mg/kg , 3 times a week
BW
for 8 weeks; additional group at
0.05 mg/kg for 12 weeks
BW
Duration: 8 or 12 weeks

substance: Mercury (inorganic) | study_details: Bernaudin et al., 1981 | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: LOAEL =
0.317 mg/kg -day
BW

substance: Mercury (inorganic) | study_details: Study Type: subchronic
Species: Brown Norway rats
Mode of Administration: gavage (food)
Exposure Regime: 0 or 3 mg HgCl
2
(equivalent to 2.22 mg Hg)/kg per week
BW
Duration: 60 days

substance: Mercury (inorganic) | study_details: Andres, 1984 | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: LOAEL =
0.633 mg/kg -day
BW

substance: Mercury (inorganic) | study_details: Study Type: subchronic
Species: Brown Norway rats and
Lewis rats
Mode of Administration: gavage (water)
Exposure Regime: 3 mg HgCl
2
(equivalent to 2.22 mg Hg)/kg , 2 times
BW
per week
Duration: 60 days

substance: Mercury (inorganic) | study_details: Uncertainty Factors: 1000 (10 for use
of subchronic studies, 10 for intraspecies
and interspecies variability, and 10 for
LOAEL to NOAEL conversion)
